subject: Re: [junit] Re: exiting of the execution after the test runner is completed
msgSnippet: ... Hm! That surprises me. I thought TestRunner.run() invoked System.exit(). I guess it doesn t. So much the better. Thanks, Robert! -- J. B. Rainsberger,
messageBody:
Robert Wenner wrote:

> --- cut here ---
>
> import junit.framework.*;
>
> public class SomeTest extends TestCase {
> public static void main(String args[]) {
> try {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(SomeTest.class);
> }
> finally {
> System.out.println("Cleaning up");
> }
> }
>
> public SomeTest(String name) {
> super(name);
> }
>
> public void testSomething() {
> System.out.println("Some test");
> }
> }
>
>
> Output:
>
> [robert@tiamat ~]$ javac -classpath /usr/java/junit/junit.jar:. \
> SomeTest.java
> [robert@tiamat ~]$ java -classpath /usr/java/junit/junit.jar:. SomeTest
> .Some test
>
> Time: 0.009
>
> OK (1 test)
>
> Cleaning up
> [robert@tiamat ~]$

Hm! That surprises me. I thought TestRunner.run() invoked System.exit().
I guess it doesn't. So much the better. Thanks, Robert!
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
